intro: Neoporteria subcylindrica, commonly known as the narrow-cylindrical neoporteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its foliage is aromatic, with a distinct scent reminiscent of parsley or dill. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
